name: My Honey chocolate - Weekend Glow
description: Wales' most expensive chocolate? The full fforest experience. Wrapped up in chocolate. The perfect gift for your loved ones. Limited availability, rarity of ingredients and the skill and dedication that goes into the making of every one. The fforest chocolate bar can only be eaten at fforest on this weekend and has accommodation, food, adventure and romance all included in the price. Domes and Granary lofts £295 Croglofts £335 For full details of this very special chocolate, click here. 14th of February - Friday to Sunday. Prices are based on a couple sharing (and well behaved dog at fforest), This is a child free weekend.

name: Opinel fold saw
description:
Wonderful and handy to carry around in the garden with you.
With teeth SO sharp,
the Opinel locking saw is large enough and perfect for cutting branches and foliage of up to 8/9cm in diameter

The handle is made from durable French natural beech wood, and the Opinel serrated blade is effective, precise, elegant.

18cm High Grade Carbon Steel Saw Blade (very sharp)
There is a clip on the top to hold the saw in position when in use.

Opinel was founded in 1890, Savoie France by Joseph Opinel. 
Today the company retains the original values of simplicity, reliability and value.

Now go and sort out those branches!

name: Pruning knife
description:
Always handy to have near to hand in the garden.

This Opinel Pruning Knife has a varnished Beech handle and carbon steel blade. 
There is safety ring VIROBLOC to lock the blade in the open or closed position.

With its curved blade bevelled on both sides, this is the ideal tool for shrub pruning or cutting ties

8 cm blade length

Opinel was founded in 1890, Savoie France by Joseph Opinel. 
Today the company retains the original values of simplicity, reliability and value.

You have to be over 18 to by this.

name: Small wooden kuska toasting cup
description:
A lovely scandinavian snaps Kuska (cup).

Made in the traditional way from selected burls from birch trees.
With a reindeer leather necklace.

A very magical feeling carrying a little wooden cup pendent around your neck as you wonder into the woods ... (home-made sloe gin)

name: fforest enamel teapot
description:
This is a fforest classic, everyone at fforest has made a pot of tea in one of these cheery cherry red teapots outside on their kitchen decks.
In one of these pots there is enough to serve 4 big mugs of tea.

We also have them in fforest green.

options.name: fforest enamel teapot in cherry red
fforest enamel teapot in fforest green

name: coldatnight Welsh Wool Blanket in Red
description:
Cosy warm red welsh wool weaves to snuggle into this winter. Bliss

We have our coldatnight blanket woven specially for us at a very old water mill near the banks of the River Teifi. The same water that flows through the Teifi, around our camp at fforest farm and past our store on Teifi wharf in cardigan is the very same water that turns the wheel that powers the loom that weaves our blankets.
 
The Mill has been weaving for 180 years, it takes a while to get good at something. The Artisan wool makers of Wales enjoy a reputation through out the world, more quality than required.
Our blanket is a traditional Welsh double cloth weave unique to fforest.
A well thought out design consisting of peony motifs within circular waves.
We have made a few tweaks and given some new colours to a very old design, giving new life to an old way.
Using pure new wool on a 1930's Dobbcross loom, each thread is put through the heddles by hand, as it always was.
We have kept the traditional chain border down the sides and blanket stitched along the ends.
 
A fforest classic to keep and to treasure, in a sea of warm berry red with Sloe, foam white, pale pebble and corn.

180 x 230 cms

We recommend that you dry clean our blankets.

SORRY THESE ARE SOLD OUT, WE ARE WAITING FOR THE RED YARN TO ARRIVE. HOPE TO HAVE THEM IN VERY SOON.

options.name: Berry red, cloud, sloe, corn and pale pebble with berry blanket stitching along 2 sides
Berry red, cloud, sloe, corn and pale pebble with sloe blanket stitching along 2 sides

name: coldatnight Welsh wool blanket in pebble grey
description:
Cosy warm welsh wool weaves to snuggle into this winter. Bliss

A well thought out design consisting of peony motifs within circular waves.
A sea of warm pebble grey, charcoal, foam white and sunrise.
We have our coldatnight welsh wool blanket woven specially for us at a very old water mill near the banks of the River Teifi. Back then the power supply came from the river.
Melin Teifil has been weaving for 180 years. it takes a while to get good at something. The Artisan wool makers of Wales enjoy a reputation through out the world; more quality than required.
Our blanket is a traditional Welsh double cloth weave unique to fforest.
We have made a few tweaks and given it some new colours to a very old design, giving new life to an old way.
Using new wool on a 1930's Dobbcross loom, each thread is put through the heddles by hand, as it always was.
We have kept the traditional chain border down the sides and blanket stitched along the ends. 

180 x 230 cms

We recommend that you dry clean our blankets.

options.name: pebble, charcoal, ecru and sunrise with donkey brown blanket stitch
pebble, charcoal, ecru and sunrise with ecru blanket stitch

name: coldatnight Welsh  Wool Blanket in cae/field green
description:
Our welsh wool blanket is a traditional double cloth weave unique to fforest. 

They are specially woven for us at Melin Teifi, a very old water mill near the banks of the River Teifi. Our design is based on a very rare and early tapestry cloth from north wales. 
We have made a few tweaks and given it some new colours, giving new life to an old way.
Using new wool on a 1930's Dobbcross loom, each thread is put through the heddles by hand, as it always was.
We have kept the traditional chain border down the sides and blanket stitched along the ends. 

180 x 230 cms

We recommend that you dry clean our blankets.

Made well in West Wales

options.name: field green, pine, cloud and autumn gold with autumn gold blanket stitching along 2 sides
Field green, pine, cloud and autumn gold with pine blanket stitching along 2 ends
Field green, pine, cloud and autumn gold with cloud blanket stitching along 2 ends

name: coldatnight Welsh Wool Blanket in haf/summer blue
description:
We have our coldatnight welsh wool blanket woven specially for us at a very old water mill near the banks of the River Teifi. 
Back then the power supply came from the river.
Melin Teifil has been weaving for 180 years.
It takes a while to get good at something. The Artisan wool makers of Wales enjoy a reputation through out the world; more quality than required.
Our blanket is a traditional Welsh double cloth weave unique to fforest.
We have made a few tweaks and given it some new colours to a very old design, giving new life to an old way.
Using new wool on a 1930's Dobbcross loom, each thread is put through the heddles by hand, as it always was.
We have kept the traditional chain border down the sides and blanket stitched along the ends. 

180 x 230 cms

We recommend that you dry clean our blankets.

Made well in West Wales

options.name: summerblue, turquoise, blackberry and cloud with cloud blanket stitching along 2 sides
summerblue, turquoise, blackberry and cloud with blackberry blanket stitching along 2 sides

name: fforest knife
description:
The fforest knife is made for us in Western Finland by one of the countries premier knife makers. Harri, a third generation knife maker who is commited to producing an excellant quality product from the Ostrobothnia region of the country.
Over the years he has developed his own exclusive style and the leather sheaths have their own distinctive style too. The fforest knife leather sheath has been embossed with our own fforest logo.
The fforest knife has a carbon steel blade and a handle carved from birch wood.
Our fforest knife is suitable for all outdoor activities, especially fishing, hunting and camping.

name: Opinel carving knife and fork
description:
You will need these this Christmas!

A beautiful carving knife and fork.
They have lovely beech handles, perfect to grip and smooth to hold. 
The knife has a 16 cm stainless steel blade which provides excellent cutting quality, is corrosion resistant and easy to sharpen.
They come with a leather thong to hang them up (off a twig, if you are cooking outside)

A great addition to your kitchen, inside or out, summer or winter.

Opinel has been manufacturing knives since 1890 with a quality and reputation.

You must be over 18 to buy this.

name: Kupilka cutlery set
description:
Kupilka Cutlery Set.
A fork, knife, spoon and teaspoon. 
Perfect for picnics and outdoor eating.

They look like wood but are also a bit like plastic, thats because they are made from a bio material made up of 50% pine fibre (wood) and 50% plastic.  
Developed by Puugia, the Centre for Wood Technology in Joensuu, Finland.

They doesn't require maintenance, doesn't "absorb" smells and are insensitive to humidity.
They are dishwasher proof, recyclable and all the packaging made from recycled cardboard.

Weight 56g per set.
Made well in Finland.

name: Opinel fold saw 12cm
description:
Opinel Folding Saw

The smaller locking blade Opinel saw. With its blade designed with razor-sharp teeth like knives, cutting is clean, even and effortless, achieved simply by pulling.

High grade carbon steel blade - 12cm
Locking - Safety ring VIROBLOC

The handle is made from durable French natural beech wood, and the Opinel serrated blade is effective, precise, elegant.

You must be over 18 to buy this.

name: Firestriker steel with Antler handle
description:
These Swedish firesteels will not let you down even when other lighters and matches fail. 

This is a nice firestriker steel made in the Swedish part of Lapland using the traditional natural material of reindeer antler for the handle. 

A firestriker steel is an essential component of any bushcraft or survival kit and this firestriker steel comes with real character. 
A quality all-weather fire-steel of 12000+ strikes. 
The exposed steel is approx. 6 cm long. The total length about 11 cm.
 
The handle is made from reindeer antler with a small native reindeer symbol.
A reindeer leather lanyard is looped through a hole in the handle.
All the handles differ in colour and shape slightly.

name: coldatnight welsh wool blanket the dark specials
description:
A limited edition of dark colours, only 3 of each have been made. . . we can't decide which one we like best, thats why they are specials.
Inky-blue skyatnight, burnt oak or soft charcoal, all with a soft natural and grey reverse side (quite a contrast).

We have our coldatnight blanket woven specially for us at a very old water mill near the banks of the River Teifi. The same water that flows through the Teifi, around our camp at fforest farm and past our store on Teifi wharf in cardigan is the very same water that turns the wheel that powers the loom that weaves our blankets. 

The Mill has been weaving for 180 years, it takes a while to get good at something. The Artisan wool makers of Wales enjoy a reputation through out the world, more quality than required. 
Our blanket is a traditional Welsh double cloth weave unique to fforest. 
A well thought out design consisting of peony motifs within circular waves. 
We have made a few tweaks and given some new colours to a very old design, giving new life to an old way. 
Using pure new wool on a 1930's Dobbcross loom, each thread is put through the heddles by hand, as it always was. 
We have kept the traditional chain border down the sides and blanket stitched along the ends. 

A fforest classic to keep and to treasure.

180 x 230 cms

We recommend that you dry clean our blankets

options.name: midnight blue / glas hanner nos with red blanket stiching
burnt oak with oak blanket stitching

name: coldatnight Welsh Wool Blanket cushions
description:
We've taken the fabric from our coldatnight welsh wool blankets and produced a cushion that will complement any traditional or contemporary interior. 
Produced in Cardigan Bay from cloth unique to fforest, woven in an old woolen mill near the banks of the River Teifi. 
coldatnight cushions are available in various colours which change seasonally.
As these cushions are made by hand the pattern positions all vary slightly from one another. We think that this is a good thing and we hope that you do too.


size 18" x 18"
Includes the feather pad.
With out pad is an option.

Made well in West Wales

name: compass
description:
Get out there but don't get lost!
Always handy to carry in your backpack or around your neck on the lanyard.
This Silva Ranger3 is a great tool when out there walking or cycling the hills.
It has a declination scale, tactile grip ring, red/ black north and south orienting lines plus the little magnifying bit means you can always read the small print!

Made in Sweden with a 5 year warranty

name: fforest cymraeg prints: cadno (fox)
description:
fforest cymraeg prints are a series of posters illustrating the welsh words that are important to us at fforest.
'cadno' fox
 
Printed by the fforest elves on high quality mould made paper. Individual word prints are available in A4 (297 X210mm) and A3 297 x 420mm) 
Our multiple image print (fforest y cymraeg) is available in A3 and A2 (420x 594mm)

Prints are available unframed or framed in natural oak. The framing is beautifully done here so please be patient and allow a little extra time for the delivery.

name: fforest cymraeg: gwiwer
description:
fforest cymraeg prints are a series of prints illustrating the welsh words that are important to us at fforest. 
'gwiwer' squirrel

Printed by the fforest elves on high quality mould made art paper. Individual word prints are available in A4 (297 X210mm) and A3 297 x 420mm)  

Prints are available unframed or framed in natural oak. The framing is beautifully done here so please be patient and allow a little extra time for the delivery.

name: fforest cymraeg 'ceirw' deer
description:
fforest cymraeg prints are a series of posters illustrating the welsh words that are important to us at fforest. 

'ceirw' deer

These are printed by the fforest elves on high quality mould made paper. individual word prints are available in A4 (297 X210mm) and A3 297 x 420mm)  

Prints are available unframed or framed in natural oak. The framing is beautifully done here so please be patient and allow a little extra time for the delivery.

name: fforest cymraeg essentials
description:
fforest cymraeg prints are a series of posters illustrating the welsh words that are important to us at fforest.

Cwtch,  Hiraeth, Twymder, Teulu, Nos, Tywydd, Twmpath, Bwyd and Cariad.
Cosy, Longing, Warmth, Family, Night, weather, Dance, Food and my love.

These are printed by the fforest elves on high quality mould made paper. Our multiple image print (fforest y cymraeg) is available in A3 and A2 (420x 594mm)



Prints are available unframed or framed in natural oak. The framing is beautifully done here so please be patient and allow a little extra time for the delivery.

name: fire steel
description:
'Magfire' a magnesium firestarter developed by survival experts to work!

An important and reliable fire making tool when hiking, even when wet or in a storm or if below freezing point, glowing sparks from a single strike will make a camp fire.
 ...  dry tinder / kindling is needed.

Fire will give you protection and warmth, make your water drinkable and cook your food.
Magfire is used by hunters, hikers, fishermen and sailors, pilots and survival experts and also adventurers in the back garden.

Designed in Finland made in the EU

name: Firelighting tinder kit
description:
A wonderful little firelighting kit from Sweden containing everything needed to make a fire without matches. 

Flintstone, a traditional firesteel, amadou tinder, shavings of 'fat wood' from Scandinavian pine tree stumps and a bundle of last year's dried grass all neatly packaged in a delightful gift box, instructions included.

Made in the forest region of Swedish Lapland utilising the old knowledge and techniques that have been used for centuries by the forest people who have lived and worked there.

A lovely gift.

name: Diamond knife sharpener
description:
It is a diamond sharpener that will help you keep your knife, axe or other tools sharp. 

The pocket size means you can take it with you wherever you are going. 
It is double sided with a coarse and a fine side. The coarse side has a diamond grain size of 60 micron, which will quickly and effectively restore or re-shape a blades edge. The fine side with grain size of 30 micron is used to remove the scratches of larger grits and to refine an edge honing it like a traditional whetstone. 

The size of each diamond covered side is 7.5cm (3 inches) x 2cm (0.75 inch).

This is a fine piece of performance equipment made in Sweden with handcrafted features. 

Comes with a leather sheath.

name: coldatnight utility blanket
description:
These are our 100% wool proper warm, strong utility blanket that we give to our campers at fforest.
Each one is a slightly different shade of greenish brown with thin stripes of warm red or mustard runing down the sides. 

They have new blanket stiching along the two shorter ends. 
And our coldatnight logo is embroidered on one end.


Approx size ... 198 cm x 129 cm  

If and when you need to clean your blanket, machine wash on a cool wool setting and cool tumble dry or even better line dry in the sun.  

Keep warm and happy.

options.name: greenish brown with thin red stripes and red blanket stiching
greenish brown with thin mustard stripes and ecru blanket stiching
greenish brown with thin red stripes and ecru blanket stitching
greenish brown with thin mustard stripes and red blanket stitching

name: welsh word mugs
description:
We love these. 
Beautiful and simple glazed white porcelain mugs embossed with Welsh words. 
 hug/cuddle - 'cwtch' in deep pink lettering.
 love you - 'caru ti' in red lettering.
 Love - 'Cariad' in red lettering 

By Keith Brymer Jones.
Dishwasher safe.

Height:8cm, diameter:10.5cm

name: Proper Welsh nomnom Chocolate
description:
Liam has created in his small kitchen in west Wales the most yummy and delicious nomnom chocolate bars.
nomnom was launched in november 2011 with a £4000 loan from the Princes Trust when Liam was only 18.

Made from the worlds finest cacao, combined with the very best Welsh ingredients from local producers. 
Tastes from the Welsh hills, the seasons and the sea.

Fabulous flavours of Venuzalan 44% or Ecuadorian 72% chocolate combined with Madagascan vanilla pods, little flakes of oak smoked Angelsey sea salt, Fresh garden mint, Welsh Lavenders, fresh chilli, Welsh Vodka and a Raspberry jelly center, Damson jelly and Celteg Sloe Gin or British hazelnuts roasted over an open flame .. to name but a few!

yumyum nomnom

options.name: 44% Tregroes Toffee Waffle cinnamon and salted caramel
72% Halenmon Caramel Ecuadorian dark chocolate and calonwen butter caramel with oak smoked anglesey sea salt
72% Welsh Coffee Co Dragon blend espresso beans

name: Utility rucksack fforest warmth 'twymder'
description:
We have given new life to this WWII Swedish Army Rucksack, a classic military bag made from strong cotton canvas on a metal frame with adjustable leather straps and a waist belt. 

We have added our own fforest twist to each one, with a new cord, a fforest 'Twymder' meaning warmth in Welsh embroidery and a coldatnight blanket pocket on the front.

Although they have seen a bit of life before they are are in amazing condition.
Each one being slightly different, different scuffs, different leather, a slightly different shade of army green and a different size pocket. 
So makes each one unique. 

Although we say it ourselves we think they look fabulous!
Limited supply, when they have gone they have gone.

Unfortunately they come in only one size which is medium. Made for the slighter body (not fforest chief size).

name: fjallraven 'vintage' 20L Rucksack
description:
WE love this rucksack by Fjallraven (Swedish for arctic fox). 
The retro classic design upholds tradition and uses classic materials without sacrificing modern functions. 
Made from durable G-1000 with a soft and wonderful feel.
Soft leather straps and metal buckles on the lid and side pockets. 
Air Vent support system and padded shoulder straps, making it light and comfortable to carry. 
Snow lock at the top of the main compartment and pocket in the top lid. 
Make this a perfect everyday pack for office, school and day trips.

A very roomy 20L

name: Kuksa
description:
Kuksa Wooden Cup

While out walking take on your travels and drink your water out of this lovely hand carved cup.
Made using rare gnarled birch mellowed by the midnight sun, the northern lights and the crackling frosts.
A traditional design fashioned with true craftsmanship following ancient tradition.

With a twirled reindeer leather hanger.

Handmade in Lapland

Now how lovely is that!

name: coldatnight Welsh Wool Blanket scarf
description:
You have the wonderful coldatnight welsh wool coldatnight blanket that you put your bed.
To keep you warm this winter, wrap this beautiful and cosy coldatnight scarf around you.
We have put blanket stitching all the way around the edges.

Looking good and feeling cosy.

Four colours to choose from
and two sizes
180 cm x 20 cm approx £55
180 cm x 33 cm approx £75

Made very well at a small woolen mill, near the banks of the Teifi, the same river that wraps around fforest.
West Wales 
100% pure new wool 

We love them. (especially fforest chief)

options.name: Narrow berry red, natural, corn and sloe with cloud blanket stitch
Narrow summer haf blue, cloud, sea green and blackberry with sea green stitching
summer haf blue, cloud, sea blue and blackberry with sea green blanket stitching
Narrow grey, slate, cloud and marmalade with cloud stiching
grey, slate, cloud and marmalade with cloud blanket stitching
Narrow field cai green, pine, cloud and rust with pine stitching
field cai green, pine, cloud and rust with pine blanket stiching

name: Stag Antler Whistle
description:
A lovely whistle hand made from Stag antler with a soft Reindeer leather lanyard to hang around your neck.

The whistle is approx. 5.5cm in length

Each one is slightly different in colour and shape.

name: Feuerhand Hurricane lantern
description:
The classic hurricane lamp, made in Germany by Feuer Hand for more than ninety years. 
With coloured plating over the standard chrome to provide additional protection against rust. Features  Schott heat-proof glass and fuel tank with leak-proof guarantee. Fuelled by highest-quality lamp oil (i.e. liquid paraffin) and recommended for outdoor use only. 
We use these at fforest as they create such a soft and atmospheric light.

Available in red or green.

Made well in Germany

name: Swedish  Hunters Liniment
description:
The Swedish Hunters Liniment come in a birch bark pot with a birch and reindeer leather lid.

In the pot is a traditional remedy made using natural products found in the forests of lapland, with  old knowledge that has been passed down through the generations of forest people.
 
Similar to a deep heat cream, use as a muscle rub.
It looks so nice you just want to use it.
Smells lovely.

5.5cm high
5.5cm diameter

name: fforest cymraeg 'cwtch'
description:
fforest cymraeg prints are a series of posters illustrating the welsh words that are important to us at fforest. 
'cwtch' cuddle and cosy place

These are printed by the fforest elves on high quality mould made paper. Individual word prints are available in A4 (297 X210mm) and A3 297 x 420mm) 

Prints are available unframed or framed in natural oak. The framing is beautifully done here so please be patient and allow a little extra time for the delivery.

name: fforest cymraeg: twymder
description:
fforest cymraeg prints are a series of prints illustrating the welsh words that are important to us at fforest.
 'twymder' meaning warmth.
 
Printed by the fforest elves on high quality mould made art paper. Individual word prints are available in A4 (297 X210mm) 
and A3 297 x 420mm)  
The multiple image print (fforest y cymraeg) is available in A3 and A2 (420x 594mm)

Prints are available unframed or framed in natural oak. The framing is beautifully done here so please be patient and allow a little extra time for the delivery.

name: fforest cymraeg: hiraeth
description:
fforest cymraeg prints are a series of posters illustrating the welsh words that are important to us at fforest. 
'cwtch' cuddle and cosy place

These are printed by the fforest elves on high quality mould made paper. Individual word prints are available in A4 (297 X210mm) and A3 297 x 420mm) 

Prints are available unframed or framed in natural oak. The framing is beautifully done here so please be patient and allow a little extra time for the delivery.

name: Gift certificate
description:
A perfect gift for someone who you don't know what to give.
They can then choose, whether it is towards a fforest holiday or an activity or on something in our shop.
Have fun deciding!

We can make up a gift certificate for any amount, just give us a call.

name: coldatnight welsh wool blanket key rings
description:
Keys need key rings ...
so here you can carry a little piece of fforest around with you,
a piece of coldatnight welsh wool blanket sewn into a little key ring.
Perfect.

Four colours to choose from
Hand made in wales by fforest elves
Patterns may vary slightly
100% pure wool woven in Wales, cotton webbing tab and metal keyring

Approx. 7cmx15cm
pure new wool, cotton tag, metal ring

name: Kelly Kettle 'Scout' 1.3 litre
description:
The Kelly Kettle is the traditional kettle of West of Ireland fishermen.
It will boil water in 3-5 minutes depending on the type of fuel used, in almost any weather conditions so guaranteeing a cuppa even in the rain! 
Made from Aluminium, it is essentially a double walled chimney with the water contained in the chimney wall.
Once the kettle is filled with water, a small fire is lit in the base. The kettle sits on the base and additional fuel (twigs, leaves, paper, dry animal dung) can be dropped down the chimney.
Kelly kettles are extremely portable pieces of essential kit....take it to the beach, on a canoe trip, a day's fishing or Wilderness camping..... use to simply boil water or with the addition of the cook set it is also possible to heat food.
This kettle boils enough water to fill 3 good mugs full.

Made well in the UK

name: coldatnight welsh wool blanket musette
description:
The musette has long been used by professional cycling teams to not only feed their riders but to advertise and market their sponsors. Colourful creative designs are part of the musettes heritage.

Using our coldatnight weaves, we are really pleased to bring you our very own fforest musette. (thank you evilgordon)
They are made with an adjustable strap, 3 metal poppers along the top. There is a reflector tab on the side and we have added an internal pocket to keep your phone handy.

Each musette is hand made by a specialist manufacture in Bristol, where modern techniques quality fabrics and components are used to ensure a robust, hardwearing musette.
If you don't ride a bike you can still carry a musette!

The classic 
Dimensions: 34cm x 27cm

100% new wool outer with waxed cotton liner and nylon strap
Made well in Britain

options.name: Berryred plaid with red wax cotton liner,black pocket red strap
Grey tapestry with grey  wax cotton liner charcoal strap
Berryred tapestry with red wax cotton liner and navy strap
Summer blue plaid with navy wax liner and navy strap
Field green tapestry with orange wax liner and brown strap
Field green tapestry with pine green wax liner and mud brown strap strap

name: Reindeer Hide
description:
Beautiful reindeer hides are a classic part of a fforest stay.

We source our reindeer hides from a family run business up in the Arctic Circle who have gained a reputation across Scandinavia for their consistent fine quality.
Hides are a by product of farming reindeer for food and they are naturally cured without the use of chemicals. 

With a soft, deep pile giving a luxurious feel.
fforest reindeer hides are premium quality and shedding is therefore kept to a minimum.

If you  have stayed with us at our camp or drank coffee in our cafe, you'll have experienced the warmth and cosiness that the reindeer hides bring to any interior.  
We love them draped over an armchair or sofa.

These Reindeer hides are a beautiful mix of grey, brown and cream shades and the natural variation of shading gives each hide a unique pattern. 

Length 130cm to 150cm  Width 80cm-90cm  - may vary slightly.

name: Mushroom knife
description:
This Mushroom knife is made for us in Western Finland by one of the countries premier knife makers. Harri, a third generation knife maker who is commited to producing an excellant quality product from the Ostrobothnia region of the country.
  
It is perfect to carry with you in the forest on your mushroom forages, also good for cleaning the mushrooms at home with the integrated bristle brush.

Bristles, handmade leather sheath.
Made in Lapland


 

You need to be over 18 to buy this product

name: Kupilka Toasting Cup
description:
Kupilka is a small Schnapps toasting Cup 
Kuplika means 'little cup' in Finnish. Inspired by the traditional Sami wooden Kuska cup that has become a long standing favorite drinking cup in Scandinavia.

Produced from an environmentally friendly Biomaterial developed by Puugia, the centre for wood Technology in Joensuu, finnland. 
50% wood fiber and 50% plastic
Each of the Kupilka cups have a unique pattern which makes them much more interesting. Maintenance free, does not absorb smells or moisture.

Has a long Reindeer leather lanyard so that it can be worn around the neck.

Dishwasher proof and fully recyclable

Made in Finland

name: The possibles bag
description:
We like to call this soft leather pouch the 'possibles' bag.
 
This is not a "survival kit" in the sense they are normally thought of. This is a 'Possibles' for everyday. 
18th century trappers used to carry a bag that contained everything that they might possibly need in a day. 

For adventures we keep essentials in it like a fire strike, a classic swiss army pen knife, some Beck Olja and a knife sharpener.
But it is a lovely bag to keep anything you like in.

Handcrafted from 1.2mm fully vegetable tanned reindeer leather from freely grazing reindeer in lapland.
In Lapland the Sami keep their salt or coffee in them.

The bag is  approx 23cm x 11cm x 6cm

name: coldatnight Welsh Wool Blanket in Berry red plaid
description:
A beautiful welsh wool blanket. 
Woven for us at the same wonderful woolen mill up the Teifi river from here by Raymond. Using time old weaving methods on a Dobcross loom.
Warm and cosy and 100% pure new wool it feels lighter than the double cloth.
Blanket stitched on two ends.
A must as the nights are drawing in.
Three gorgeous colours to choose from.

Approx 180cm x 230cm in size
Dry cleaning is advised

options.name: berry, cloud, pink and sloe with cloud blanket stitch
berry, cloud, pink and sloe with red blanket stitch

name: coldatnight Welsh Wool Blanket in heather plaid
description:
From the same wonderful woolen mill up the Teifi river from here, Raymond has woven this plaid welsh wool blanket for us.
Warm and cosy and 100% pure new wool it feels lighter than the double cloth.
Blanket stitched on two ends.

Three gorgeous colours to choose from.

Approx 180cm x 230cm in size

options.name: heather blue, cloud, sky blue and indigo with sky blanket stitching
heather blue, cloud, sky blue and indigo with cloud blanket stitching

name: coldatnight Welsh Wool Blanket in pebble grey plaid
description:
From the same wonderful woolen mill up the Teifi river from here, Raymond has woven this plaid welsh wool blanket for us.
Warm and cosy and 100% pure new wool it feels lighter than the double cloth.
Blanket stitched on two ends.

Three gorgeous colours to choose from.

Approx 180cm x 230cm in size

options.name: pebble grey, cloud, russet and peat with peat stitching
pebble grey, cloud, russet and peat with russet stitching

name: coldatnight Welsh Wool Blanket cushions in plaid
description:
This twill weave plaid is woven for us at the same woolen mill up the Teifi river as our double cloth. Using time old weaving methods on a Dobcross loom by Raymond. 

As these cushions are made by hand, so the pattern positions all vary slightly from one another. We think that this is a good thing and we hope that you do too.

size 18" x 18" 
Includes the feather pad. 

100% pure new wool. 
Made well in West Wales

options.name: coldatnight plaid cushion in berry red
coldatnight plaid cushion in pebble grey
coldatnight plaid cushion in heather blue

name: FjallRaven Greenland Wax
description:
Impregnation for your Greenland garments to keep the water out!

It is made to an old prescription, no spray gasses or solvents.
Apply the Greenland wax on the garment or the parts that you want to be water repellant.
Friendly to the environment.

Made from Paraffin and beeswax

name: utility rucksack fforest nautical flags
description:
We have given new life to this WWII Swedish Army Rucksack, a classic military bag made from strong cotton canvas on a metal frame with adjustable leather straps and a waist belt. 

We have added our own fforest twist to each one, with a new cord, a fforest 'nautical flags' embroidery.

Although they have seen a bit of life before they are are in amazing condition.
Each one being slightly different, different scuffs, different leather, a slightly different shade of army green. 
So makes each one unique. 

Although we say it ourselves we think they look fabulous!
Limited supply, when they have gone they have gone.

Unfortunately they come in only one size which is medium. Made for the slighter body (not fforest chief size).

name: Opinel key ring
description:
When you just need a tiny knife to cut something, this is the thing.

A tiny little knife on a key ring.

Perfect.

Stainless steel blade, wooden handle, metal chain and ring.

Made in France.

name: Fjallraven No.21 Rucksack small
description:
Fjallraven No.21 Rucksack

A design inspired by the Fjällräven archives.
Made from a durable G-1000® fabric construction, impregnated with natural parrafin and beeswax, which means the vintage backpack is durable and weather-resistant for extreme hiking conditions. 
Featuring a snow lock, a padded bottom and removable seat pad and a pocket that holds a thermos in an upright position. 
Also with comfortable padded Shoulder Straps and leather detailing.
 
It is true you are unlikely to use this for extreme hiking but you know it does get tough on your every day running about.
There is no doubt you’ll need this strong bag (and it looks really good).


Made from Fjallraven G1000 Heavy Duty material. 
Dimensions: height 42cm width 25cm depth 12cm
Volume: 15L

name: Kupilka
description:
Kupilka is a classic Scandinavian drinking cup. 
Inspired by the traditional Sami wooden Kuska cup that has become a long standing favorite drinking cup in Scandinavia.
Traditionally they are carved out of wood and carried on a thong on your belt when out in the woods.
It will hold about 210ml and comes with a reindeer leather lanyard.
These cups are produced from an environmentally friendly Biomaterial developed by Puugia, the centre for wood Technology in Joensuu, finnland. 
50% wood fiber and 50% plastic
Each of the Kupilka cups have a unique pattern, due to the high wood content, so makes them much more interesting. 
Maintenance free, they do not absorb smells or moisture.

They are also fully recyclable

Comes in a cardboard packaging

Made in Finland

name: cariad mugs
description:
Here we have a set of 2 love mugs in white glazed porcelain embossed with the Welsh word for Love - 'Cariad' 
by Keith Brymer Jones.

They are packaged in a lovely box, making it a perfect gift. 

Dishwasher safe.
Height:8cm, diameter:10.5cm

name: Llaeth milk jug
description:
This is a lovely white glazed porcelain jug embossed with the Welsh word for milk -'llaeth' in blue letters. 

designed by Keith Brymer Jones.

Dishwasher safe.

Height: 9.5cm, diameter:9cm

name: Welsh word eggcup set
description:
Four little white glazed porcelain eggcups 'cwpanuwy' each with the welsh word for egg 'Wy' embossed on the front.

A lovely way to start the day, with an egg 'Wy'


by Keith Brymer Jones. 
Dishwasher safe.

name: cariad cream jug
description:
This small white glazed porcelain jug 'Jwg Bach' is embossed with the Welsh word for Love - 'Cariad'

Very cute, would make a lovely gift and it's already packaged in a simple box.
 
Made by Keith Brymer Jones.

Dishwasher and microwave safe.

Height:5.8cm, diameter:7.1cm

name: fforest utility apron
description:
Strong cotton twill waist apron in camel khaki colour.

For the pizza tipi this summer down on the quay in Cardigan we had these aprons for every one to wear.
fforest embroidered on the front in creamy colour.
Wide and strong with long green herringbone tapes to tie around your waist.
We wore ours with a fisherman's smock.

65 cm long x 106 cm wide

Perfect

name: Kitchen prep knife set
description:
When peeling, paring and prepping vegetables, it is always made so much more enjoyable when using lovely tools to do it with.

We love this set of 4 Opinel kitchen knives.
A 7cm peeler, paring knife with a 10cm blade ideal for chopping, serrated knife with a 10cm blade ideal for slicing tomatoes.
And a curved vegetable knife, with a serrated back good for scraping and cleaning.

All have beech handles with a natural varnish. The blades are made from Sandvik stainless steel, renowned for their cutting qualities. 
They come in a cardboard gift box.
A perfect gift for any cook.

You must be over 18 to buy this.

name: Opinel Bread Knife No.116
description:
An essential from the French home kitchen, this Opinel bread knife is strong and efficient, with a curved, serrated blade and a beechwood handle that allows a comfortable grip.
A must for all you Real Bread lovers.

 Stainless steel 21 cm blade, 
 Natural varnish beechwood handle
 Dishwasher safe
 Made well in France

name: fforest welsh honey
description:
Very very local to us here at fforest it is our favorite honey.
We use this honey from New quay honey farm every day for our camp breakfast and it goes really well.
Here we have it in a 227g jar.
Taste the sweetness of the summer.

Made well by the honey bees of Ceredigion, West Wales

name: fforest coffee pot
description:
A very cheery cherry red enamel coffee pot that goes well with the fforest tea pot.
To make a good pot of coffee cowboy style, 
put 3 heaped spoons of medium ground coffee beans onto the pot 
fill up with boiling water and stir. Leave to brew for 6 minuets or maybe a bit more to let the grounds sink to the bottom of the pot and then pour. mmm

Plenty of coffee for 5 mugs.

name: Enamel Mugs
description:
You have drank out of the fforest enamel mugs in your fforestcamp kitchen, now you can drink out of them at home too.  
  
1/2 pint mug in ffantastic red or fforest green

From the UK distributor of Falcon Enamelware, which originates back to the 1920's.

name: Fjallraven Camper 20L backpack
description:
We love Fjallraven!
The Camper is a durable backpack that is loaded from the top and works for work or school, on day trips or when packing for a short trip. 
The large main compartment with a waterproof zip provides easy access to your contents. 
There is a padded compartment inside for a 13-inch laptop and several other pockets, including a safety pocket, a spacious pocket in the lid, a bellow pocket in the front providing extra storage, and the expandable bellow side pockets to hold bottles, etc. 
Elastic cord and reflector on the front. 
The back panel is ergonomically designed with ventilating mesh, shoulder straps and chest strap with safety whistle.
Detachable hip belt. Waterproof, durable bottom that provides stability.
What more could you ask for?

options.name: red with contrasting bright blue zips

name: Gransfors Bruks small forest axe
description:
A traditional axe with a thin blade and a long enough handle to allow for powerful chopping but will also fit into a rucksac. 
This axe has a 19'' hickory handle and a 3 1/4'' face and is supplied with a grain leather sheath.
We use the this axe for splitting small sticks for the fire or cutting small diameter limbwood for starter fuel in a fireplace.


19'' handle and 3 1/4'' face. Weight - 1kg
Made in Sweden by our favorite axe makers.

name: Gransfors Bruks small splitting Axe
description:
Traditional forged axe with a thin blade which helps the axe to go fast into the wood and then split efficiently when the thicker part hits and pushes apart the wood. The small splitting axe has a 2-1/2lb head, 2-1/2'' face and 20'' textured hickory handle. 
The Small Splitting Axe is provided with a grain leather sheath with snap fastener.
We use this axe for splitting kindling and smallish stove wood. Note, this axe's poll is not hardened for use as a sledge. 

Made in Sweden by our favourite axe makers.

Length 60cm. Weight 1.6kg

name: Opinel Round tipped safety Knife
description:
Opinel knives were created in 1890.
These Opinel knives have stainless steel blades by Swedish steel maker Sandvik.  
This round-tipped safety knife is ideal for the younger person as a first knife, allowing children to learn how to carve wood under adult supervision. 
Because of its round tip and double safety ring feature "VIROBLOC", a locking ring which locks the blade open or closed as required. It is great for preventing blades closing upon vulnerable fingers. 

Handle: Beech wood
Blade: 7cm
Steel: Stainless
weight: only 36 g
Natural beech wood
Made well in Savioe, France

You must be over 18 to buy these

name: Opinel Classic pen knife
description:
We always carry a small knife when out on adventures in the woods or paddling down the river or to secret beaches across the sea.
Useful for picnics, whittling, carving and cutting.
Handy and fits easily into your pocket and bag.

The Classic Original Opinel with a Virobloc safety lock.
Varnished hornbeam handle and Sandvik stainless steel 8cm blade.
Now in lovely bright colours!

Made well in their Savoie Factory, France


You must be over 18 to buy this product

name: Fjallraven kanken
description:
The Kanken is an unchanged classic, once a trusty schoolbag that has since become iconic. 
Developed at the end of the 70s when Åke Nordin the founder of fjalraven, sketched a boxy cut, functional and affordable backpack that met the needs of children to carry their books to school. 
Standout detailing includes a removeable seat, a newspaper pocket to the side, a top handle and safety reflector within the Fjallraven logo. There is a name and address tag inside and zippered pocket to the front. 
This bag is contructed with extremely durable Vinylon F, a functional fabric that swells like natural fibres, which makes it waterproof so does not need additional treatment.
 
Weight 290g 
Depth 13 cm 
Height 38 cm 
Width 27 cm 
Volume Approx. 16 Litres 

Fab colours, Love it!

name: Beck-olja
description:
Quiet a particular foresty smell!

With a strong pine tar smell this is product brings you a real feeling of northern Scandinavian forest. 
The original forest perfume of Lapland derived from traditional pine tar production. 
Which has been used for centuries in Lapland as protection against the dreaded mosquito plague in the summers. 

Wild boar is attracted to the smell and it can therefore be applied to lure them!

A natural product made in the forest region of Swedish Lapland utilising the old knowledge and techniques that have been used for centuries by the forest people who have lived and worked there.

The 25ml bottles last for a long time as only a small amount is needed.

Can be diluted.

name: Log BBQ
description:
For those times when you want to make a fire and barbecue on the beach or in the wild, this is what you need.
A carved-out log of Alder filled with lump wood charcoal and a little nugget of natural resin to help fire up.
Light the fire, wait for the coals to burn down, cook-up your favorite outdoor food, then throw a few sticks and logs on the embers and sit around a fire.

Safe and easy to use 100% natural and decomposes in nature without leaving a trace.

Pure pleasure!

name: Telescopic barbeque and toasting fork
description:
A clever telescopic barbeque stick with a plane wooden handle and nylon case. 

Small enough to pack in a daysack to take to the beach or camping trip.

Extends approximately 65cm. 

Or in curly birch which extends to 90cm

name: wool power socks
description:
Socks to keep your feet warm!
It is cold in Sweden and the Swedes have a deep understanding of cold weather.
Situated in the Northern part of Sweden, about 350 km south of the Polar Circle, Woolpower was founded in ÖSTERSUND in 1969. 
It is owned by Gränsfors Bruks Moderbolag, a family-owned company know for their Axes. . we love those Axes

In the early 1970s 'Ullfrotté Original' was developed by woolpower in collaboration with the Swedish military, scientists, doctors and survival experts. . . so, they should know how to keep us warm!
They knit fine merio wool mixed with polyamide into lofty terry loops, which trap air . . 80% air! 
This means that the material has an excellent capacity to trap your body heat. . . the more air you can keep still around the body, the more heat you can retain. .  even when wet they keep your feet toasty.
 
64% Merino 36% Polyamide 400g/m2
Extremely soft and very very warm
Machine washed at 60 °C and tumble-dried at medium heat. 
A requirement from the Swedish and Norwegian armies.

name: free food for rats by anja forrest dunk
description:
Anja was born to a German mother and a welsh father and while she considers Wales her 'home', she has spent chunks living her life in different countries.
This collection of recipes gives an insight into the life of a family where food has been at the heart of everything they do.
From Bavarian dumpings made by her German Grandmother, noodles in China, chorizo and bean stew cooked on an open fire in Spain.

We are thrilled and proud of Anja for producing this wonderful book.
She has cooked delicious tables of food here at fforest, enjoyed by many at the DO lectures and our fforest weddings.

Great recipies and an enjoyable read.
Also beautifully illustrated by Anja, 
Photo's by friends and family

name: FjallRaven G1000 Cap
description:
FjallRaven G1000 Cap
G1000 tight weave cloth impregnated with Greenland wax.
Durable breathable and water resistant.

Can not go wrong with this!

65% polyester
35% cotton

name: Fisherman smock
description:
An authentic fisherman's smock from Brittany.

A long sleeved shirt with a wide-open front slit for easy dressing, a single front button and closing loop on the inside of the shirt (so not prone to snag on anything) and an inside breast pocket. .  to keep things dry from sea spray.

Traditionally it is one of the first garments sewn by sailors from worn out sails.

The fisherman's smock is normally worn loosely.
It is made of a strong 100% cotton material 
Unisex
In Navy or Rust Red

Made well by Armour Lux in Brittany, France

name: Kelly Kettle Large 1.5 litre
description:
Over 4 generations the Kelly family have been making the kelly kettle in County Mayo, Ireland.
The Kelly Kettle was traditionally used by fishermen and will even boil in a storm, so a hot cuppa is always guaranteed!
Water will boil water in 3-5 minutes depending on the type of fuel used. Made from Aluminium, it is essentially a double walled chimney with the water contained in the chimney wall.
Once the kettle is filled with water, a small fire is lit in the base. The kettle sits on the base and additional fuel (twigs, leaves, paper, dry animal dung) can be dropped down the chimney.
Kelly kettles are extremely portable pieces of essential kit....take it to the beach, on a canoe trip, a day's fishing or Wilderness camping..... use to simply boil water or with the addition of the cook set it is also possible to heat food.
Boils water to fill approximately 5 mugs at a time.

name: Shetland wool roll neck jumper
description:
The Shetland sheep is native to the Shetland Islands and produces the finest and softest wool available from Scotland. This ancient breed of sheep lives only on the Shetlands and has adapted to the harsh climate with its long winters and violent storms.

Once you have put this jumper on, you will not want to take it off.
Super warm, cosy and soft yet hard wearing this casual jumper is great for men and women.
Comfortable raglan sleeves, fully fashioned with an easy roll-up hem  and a high collar.

Knitted in Scotland  by Eribe from 100% undyed Shetland wool, sheared from sheep that graze on the open pasturelands and coastlines of the Shetlands Islands. 
This wool is naturally treated with out chemicals or dyes so giving a natural, healthy fabric, with a light protection from wind and rain.

options.name: pebble large (chest width flat 63cm x 75cm long)
pebble x large (chest width flat 66cm x 74cm long)

name: Scarpa mojito shoes
description:
Urban style and performance construction.

Inspired by elements of a climbing shoe.
Scarpa's Mojito approach shoes have a soft, flexible upper, reinforced arch for support and molded Vibram® Spyder outsole that can handle busy town life or lonely trails.
Suede upper with detail stitching and a rubber toe cap to prevent damage.
Lacing to the toe for a customized fit
Removable, perforated insole.
They need no wearing in and fit like a glove, comfort!

Spirit of adventure

By Scarpa of Italy

name: Breton sailor sweater
description:
The Breton sweater called "chandail" in French traces its origin to Brittany more than 200 years ago. In the 1970's the navy woolen sweater was issued to sub-marine officers and quickly spread to surface officers and later on became the work uniform of seamen. 
Many decades later, the shirt became widely popular and is now proudly worn by those who frequent the sea: fishermen, sailors, or yachtsmen.
ArmorLux has represented the finest Breton nautical clothing for the last 70 years.
Breton sailor sweater made from close fitting knitted 100% wool
round neck and buttoned on the left shoulder.

Made well in Brittany, France

name: Shetland wool Fairisle Tank
description:
These masterpieces knitted in pure Shetland wool, follow meticulously intricate patterns established centuries ago, on Fair Isle, a tiny island sandwiched between The Shetland and The Orkney islands.
The distinctive patterns are passed down from one generation of knitters to another, so keeping the memory. 
 
These beautiful, true Fair isle sleeve-less jumpers have a comfortable low round neck, keep you warm, look fab and are a piece of history from Scotland.

Normally £125 now £85

name: Scarpa Ladies Terra GTX walking boots
description:
We at fforest love these boots!
They are so comfortable, they look great and they do the job.

The Scarpa Terra GTX is a tough boot made from oiled full grain leather which offers good support and protection while walking the trails. The upper design and construction provides instant comfort with a Gore-tex® (performance comfort footwear) lining which is breathable and ensures the wet stays out.  Grip is provided by the light weight Energy sole unit which keeps you firmly planted on the path.

Made well in northern Italy.

name: Outdoor Research Yukon cap
description:
Keep warm this winter with this fab cap!
Ultimate insulation and style for wrestling with both extreme cold and hungry Grizzly Bears.
Made by Outdoor Research, an outdoor gear company with a passion for human powered adventure, in Seattle, Washington. 

60% Wool 30% polyester 10% viscose
Woven cap with a 100% polyester knit lining
Flip-up, contoured ear caps with side button attachments
Machine Washable.
nb. they come up quite small so we only ordered larger sizes.

name: Petzl Tikkina Head Torch
description:
The  Head-torch. It’s a torch that goes on your head.
In 1972 when Petzl invented the first headlamp, the idea of attaching the lamp and the battery case to a headband was very innovative, so freeing both hands.
The Tikkina is mid-range and compact with two LED lighting modes. Run both leds for maximum brightness or switch to 1 for longer battery life (190 hours on economy setting).   
It’s simple, affordable, useful, just forget that it looks kind of silly when it’s on your head.

Takes 3 alkaline AAA batteries (included).
Weight 80 g including the batteries
3 year guarantee 
water resistant
A range of beautiful colours

name: Penguin hand powered flashlight
description:
A cute little hand powered penguin torch with an ultra bright LED.

Just squeeze the penguins arm a few times to power it up, so no need for batteries.
It also has a handy wrist strap to keep it safe on your arm.

Little ones at fforest love these torches to find their way around in the dark.
